revision.text: {{Article history |action1=GAN |action1date=15:17, 10 April 2008 (UTC) |action1result=listed |action1oldid=204693508 |action2=WAR |action2date=13:22, 26 January 2009 |action2link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/Willie Gillis |action2result=approved |action2oldid=266315504 |dykdate=9 April 2008 |currentstatus=GA |topic=art }} {{WikiProject banner shell|collapsed=yes|1= {{WikiProject Military history|class=A|A-Class=pass|US=yes|WWII=yes}} {{WikiProject Media|class=GA|importance=mid}} {{WikiProject Fictional characters|class=GA}} {{WikiProject Visual arts|class=GA}}}} {{On this day|date1=2012-10-04|oldid1=515896634|date2=2016-10-04|oldid2=742365807}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Gillis, Willie}} ==GA hold comments== I think the article is pretty close to GA. If these three issues are addressed I'll pass it. *Need citation immediately after quotations, such as ''Rockwell described Gillis as "an inoffensive, ordinary little guy thrown into the chaos of war." ''{{Y}}--[[User:TonyTheTiger|TonyTheTiger]] ([[User talk:TonyTheTiger|t]]/[[Special:Contributions/TonyTheTiger|c]]/[[User:TonyTheTiger/Antonio Vernon|bio]]/[[WP:CHICAGO]]/[[WP:LOTD]]) 13:59, 10 April 2008 (UTC) *For this kind of opinion, I'd like to see who thought it was a good ending more explicitly mentioned: ''Rockwell creatde a good ending for the series by depicting Gillis relaxing while studying at college on the [[G.I. Bill]].''{{Y}}--[[User:TonyTheTiger|TonyTheTiger]] ([[User talk:TonyTheTiger|t]]/[[Special:Contributions/TonyTheTiger|c]]/[[User:TonyTheTiger/Antonio Vernon|bio]]/[[WP:CHICAGO]]/[[WP:LOTD]]) 14:06, 10 April 2008 (UTC) *This seems out of place in the last paragraph in Post Illustrations section: ''Another of Rockwell's wartime characters was Rosie the Riveter.''{{Y}}--[[User:TonyTheTiger|TonyTheTiger]] ([[User talk:TonyTheTiger|t]]/[[Special:Contributions/TonyTheTiger|c]]/[[User:TonyTheTiger/Antonio Vernon|bio]]/[[WP:CHICAGO]]/[[WP:LOTD]]) 13:57, 10 April 2008 (UTC) [[User:Karanacs|Karanacs]] ([[User talk:Karanacs|talk]]) 19:42, 9 April 2008 (UTC) ==GA Passed== ==Successful [[Wikipedia:Good articles|good article]] nomination== I am glad to report that this article nomination for [[WP:GA|good article]] status has been promoted. This is how the article, as of April 10, 2008, compares against the [[Wikipedia:What is a good article?|six good article criteria]]: :'''1. Well written?:''' Pass :'''2. Factually accurate?:''' Pass :'''3. Broad in coverage?:''' Pass :'''4. Neutral point of view?:''' Pass :'''5. Article stability?''' Pass :'''6. Images?:''' Pass If you feel that this review is in error, feel free to take it to [[Wikipedia:Good article reassessment|Good article reassessment]]. Thank you to all of the editors who worked hard to bring it to this status, and congratulations. I think this is a really interesting article. The prose is satisfactory for GA, but if you plan to bring this to FA I'd suggest a good copyedit. Good job, and thanks for being so prompt with the changes. [[User:Karanacs|Karanacs]] ([[User talk:Karanacs|talk]]) 15:17, 10 April 2008 (UTC)
